quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Food and Sara Lee Creech
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, fruits, diemer. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This influential couturier introduced the tuxedo suit for women and was the first designer to use ethnic models in his runway shows.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yves Saint Laurent

questions.question: Ms. Sara Lee Creech met Edna Fuller, who had organized Floridas first Inter-racial Council in Orlando. After hearing Ms. Fullers speech in Orlando, the Belle Glades local organization decided to form Floridas second Inter-national Council. Which of these were not part of their missions?

options.text: To persuade Palm Beach County School Board to build an elementary school for the black community
To fight for integration of schools
To start a day care center for farm workers children.
To gain trust with the black and white community for the Council by having 15 white members and 15 black members in the council with equal votes

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To fight for integration of schools

questions.question: Which food requires more energy to be digested than it provides?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: A person cannot taste food unless it is mixed with saliva.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: At the second meeting of the Inter-racial Council, Ms. Sara Lee Creech asked some of the black parents why they would want their children to play with white dolls. What was the parents answer?

options.text: The only black baby dolls were white dolls that had defects and were taken off the production line and painted black.
There were no acceptable black dolls available.
The only black dolls in the stores were racial parodies of slave women and children.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Which statement regarding famous fashion designer Coco Chanel is NOT true?

options.text: She associated suntan with hard outdoor labor.
He real name was Gabrielle Bonheur Chanel.
The Chanel suit was made of jersey.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She associated suntan with hard outdoor labor.

questions.question: Eight months after the first meeting of the Inter-racial Council, Ms. Sara Lee Creech had an epiphany. She was walking out of the Post Office and saw two little African-American girls playing with dolls in the backseat of a car. What disturbed her about that situation?

options.text: The children were left alone in the car.
The children were dressed in rags.
The children were playing with white dolls.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The children were playing with white dolls.

questions.question: Almonds and what other fruits belong to the Rosacae (rose) family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: all of these

questions.question: The shrimps heart is in its stomach.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Donald Duck appears in an Academy Award-winning film.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What did Walter Diemer invent?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the rubber band

questions.question: There is no muscle in the human body that is attached at one end only.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Sara Lee Creech moved to Belle Glades, Florida in the 1940s.  She and others in town formed a local organization for improvement in racial relations in a very segregated world. What was her occupation in Belle Glades?

options.text: She was the mayor of the town.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She owned a florist shop.

questions.question: The first written version of the Don Juan legend was penned by Molière.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What is the worlds smallest winged insect?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tanzanian parasitic wasp

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Dolls and Doll
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, county, 1940s. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Sears manager contacted Ideal Toy Company in relation to Sara Lee Creechs idea of creating a black doll. Although the president of Ideal, Mr Clark was ready to start the production, the board wasnt sure but agreed to a meeting with Ms. Creech. What happened before their meeting?

options.text: Newsweek and Life ran lead stories about the doll and all the support people had for it.
First Lady Eleanor Roosevelt invited major black and white leaders to consult about the appropriate skin color of the doll.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Both of these

questions.question: The first dolls that could walk, talk, and open and close their eyes were made in this decade.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1900-1909

questions.question: These dolls first appeared in 1909 and were most popular in the 1940s. They were given out at county fairs as prizes and very collectible today.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kewpie Doll

questions.question: Ideal Toy Company started manufacturing the Sara Lee doll to get it on store shelves in time for what season?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Christmas 1952

questions.question: The 17-18 doll, Sara Lee, was dressed in a yellow lacy dress with a bonnet on her head. She had molded and painted hair and looked just like a beautiful African-American infant.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What store contacted Mrs. Sara Lee Creech in 1950 and invited her to a meeting?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sears  Roebucks

questions.question: Ms Sara Lee Creech received a crate of Sara Lee dolls before they went to the stores. What did she do with them?

options.text: She gave them to her family.
She took them to Lake Shore Elementary School, the school she had lobbied for with the Inter-racial Council.
She gave them to the people who supported her while she was getting these dolls made and marketed.
She donated them to the day care center the Inter-racial Council had started.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She took them to Lake Shore Elementary School, the school she had lobbied for with the Inter-racial Council.

questions.question: Betty the Beautiful Bride, Sweet Rosemary, and Debbie Darlin were in a collection of dolls in the 1940s and were priced so they were more affordable than other dolls. What was this collection called?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Grocery Store Dolls

questions.question: Ms. Sara Creech began studying the history of black dolls and the message that was sent to the children by these types of dolls. What information did she gather to justify issuing a patent for the Sara Lee doll?

options.text: Research from sociologist Kenneth Clark whose findings helped lead to the landmark decision to integrate schools
Results from tests conducted with dolls and children. Black children said that black dolls were dirty and white dolls were pretty and black dolls were bad and white dolls were good.
Research which showed that racial prejudices were transmitted through toys and games

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Ms. Sara Lee Creech had difficulty in finding a manufacturer for her doll, so she asked author-anthropologist Zora Neale Hurston for her help. Ms. Hurston contacted some very influential friends to solicit letters of support. Which person on the list was not contacted?

options.text: The Director of the Department of United Nations

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Martin Luther King III

questions.question: Ms. Sara Lee Creech was seeking support for the creation of the Sara Lee doll and was invited to a reception where she met Zora Neale Hurston, the author of Their Eyes Were Watching God. Who was this reception being held for?

options.text: The Inter-racial Council of New York

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eleanor Roosevelt

questions.question: Ms. Sara Lee Creech got in touch with the sculptress, Sheila Burlingame, who had sculpted the figurine Negro Boy Praying for the St. Louis Headquaters of the Urban League. Ms. Burlingame was very enthusiastic about creating a black doll and was ready to start. What did she ask for to help her sculpt the dolls so they would be anthropologically accurate?

options.text: hair samples and facial photos of the children
5 boys and 5 girls to model for her
photos of black children and the head measurements of different aged children
money to come to Belle Glades to work with the children there

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: photos of black children and the head measurements of different aged children

questions.question: A friendship bloomed between Ms. Sara Creech and author Nora Hurston. Ms. Hurston came to Belle Glades to help with the creation of the Sara Lee doll. She was invited to stay at Ms. Creechs house but declined. Why?

options.text: She was afraid of the part of town Ms. Creech lived in.
Ms. Creech was white and Ms. Hurston was black. Ms. Hurston didnt want her friend to face repercussions for letting a black woman stay at her house and treating her as an equal.
Ms. Creechs house was in bad condition.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ms. Creech was white and Ms. Hurston was black. Ms. Hurston didnt want her friend to face repercussions for letting a black woman stay at her house and treating her as an equal.

questions.question: What did Ms. Sara Lee Creech do when the Sara Lee doll failed?

options.text: She had to go back to Belle Glades and go on with her life there.
She went back to her florist shop and continued the many friendships she had made with the supporters of the baby doll, Sara Lee.
She became deeply involved with the Inter-racial Council and began new projects and worked with the projects already in operation.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: When the doll, Sara Lee, was put in the stores, what school board system ordered several hundred and made her the official doll of the state school board?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New York

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Chocolate and Doll
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, people, process. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This 11 to 20 tall rubber doll came out in the early 1950s. What was its name and what could it do after it drank its bottle and you squeezed its tummy?

options.text: Tiny Tears - cried little wet tears

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiny Tears - cried little wet tears

questions.question: Which statement is true about the process of creating chocolate?

options.text: Cocoa beans are left in heaps for several days to ferment.
Cocoa beans are cut from the tree with a machete.
Cocoa beans are spread in the open for 5-7 days to dry.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: This 12 doll, introduced by Ideal Toy Co. in 1956, was the first of the 50s glamour dolls. She was double marketed by Ideal and a trusted cosmetic company.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Miss Revlon

questions.question: What is the name of Harry Potters red-headed, best male friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ron Weasley

questions.question: Who were the first people known to have made chocolate?

options.text: Ancient cultures of Mexico and Central America
Ancient cultures of the Middle East

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ancient cultures of Mexico and Central America

questions.question: The main ingredients of chocolate are cocoa solids and cocoa butter.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The first battery operated doll was made of tin in the 1950s and could do something that real babies can do. What could the doll do?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: crawl

questions.question: What nationality were the people who first introduced chocolate to Europe?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spanish

questions.question: The tryptophan contained in chocolate contributes to the production of endorphins.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the name of Harry Potters brilliant female best friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hermione Granger

questions.question: Which of these statements is true about chocolate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: The secret of the cacao tree was discovered about 4000 years ago in the tropical forests of America.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: White chocolate is made from cocoa butter without cocoa solids.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The natives of Central America produced chocolate beer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of these can be found in chocolate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

quizzes.title: Knowledge Quiz: Harry Potter and Ron
quizzes.description: Test your knowledge knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Knowledge, actor, weasley. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What spell is used to conjure a patronous in the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Expecto Patronum

questions.question: Has Harry Potter ever kissed Cho Chang?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: What was the final battle of WWII in Europe which was primarily between the Germans and the Soviet forces and during which Hitler committed suicide?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Battle of Berlin

questions.question: Voldemorts real name is Tom Marvolo Riddle.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets, Harry, Hermione, and Ron drink Polyjuice Potion, so they can sneak into the Slytherin common room and find out if Draco is the heir of Slytherin. Harry and Ron successfully turn into Crabbe and Goyle, but Hermione turns into what kind of animal by mistake?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cat

questions.question: In Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix, what is the name of the group formed by Harry, Ron, and Hermione?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dumbledores Army

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a horcrux?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Godric Gryffindors sword

questions.question: It is mentioned several times throughout the series that Harry Potter looks like his ___, but has his ___s eyes. Fill in the blanks.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dad, mom

questions.question: In this battle British general Montgomery ended the German/Italian threat to Egypt and the Suez Canal by a decisive victory in 1942 that proved to be the turning point of the war in North Africa.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: El Alamein

questions.question: How many children do Arthur and Molly Weasley have?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: Who is the actor who portrays Ron in all of the Harry Potter films?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rupert Grint

questions.question: What are the names of Harry Potters school enemies?

options.text: Draco Malfoy, Vincent Crabbe, and Gregory Goyle
Draco Malfoy, Gregory Goyle, and Cedric Diggory
Dudley Dursley, Seamus Finigan, and Vincent Crabbe

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Draco Malfoy, Vincent Crabbe, and Gregory Goyle

questions.question: What is the name of Harry Potters mean cousin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dudley Dursley

questions.question: Which of these is one of the three unforgivable curses in the Harry Potter series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: What is the name of Hogwarts half-giant groundskeeper?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rubeus Hagrid

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Battle and Island
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, girlfriends, snakes. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Soviets successful defense of this city and destruction of a German army in heavy, bloody fighting in 1942-43 is often called the turning point of WWII.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stalingrad

questions.question: In 1944, the Japanese Navy made a last all-out effort to defeat the US Navy in a battle in the waters of the Philippines. The Japanese made a three pronged attack on the US Navy and US Marines landing on an island in the Philippines. However, in this naval battle the US Navy sank many Japanese ships and gained almost total dominance of the Pacific Ocean. From that time on the Japanese navy could do little except launch suicide planes to try to stop the advance of Allied forces toward Japan. What was the name of this great battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leyte Gulf

questions.question: About five months after the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor, carriers of the Japanese navy and the US navy fought in the South Pacific. It was the first time in history that opposing ships never sighted each other - only their aircraft crews saw their opponents. Though the US force took heavy losses, they were able to stop the Japanese invasion of Port Moresby in New Guinea. What was the name of the battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Coral Sea

questions.question: Possibly the largest tank battle in history was fought in 1943 near a Soviet city that gives its name to the battle. Both sides took heavy losses of tanks and men but in the end the Soviets prevailed and the Germans had to begin the long retreat that would eventually take them all the way back to Germany. What was the name of the city and the battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Kursk

questions.question: What potion did Harry Potter, Ron and Hermione make to take the form of someone else?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Polyjuice potion

questions.question: What did Harry Potter pull out of the old sorting hat?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Godric Gryffindors Sword

questions.question: What language does Harry Potter speak to communicate with snakes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Parseltounge

questions.question: On and near what island in the Soloman Island group was the Japanese advance in the South Pacific stopped in 1943, after about six months of brutal fighting between the land and naval force of the US and Japan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Guadalcanal

questions.question: In this Pacific battle in 1942, the US Navy sank four Japanese aircraft carriers while losing only one of their own. It is generally considered the turning point of the war in the Pacific. The battle is named after an island which the Japanese intended to capture but were halted by their losses in the naval battle. What is the name of the island and the battle?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Midway

questions.question: What is Percy Weasleys girlfriends name in the Harry Potter books?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Penelope Clearwater

questions.question: What was the monster in the fictional Chamber of Secrets?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Basilisk

questions.question: Also known as D-Day, this was the invasion of German-occupied northern France in 1944 by British, Canadian, US and other allied nations troops.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Normandy Landings

questions.question: In the late summer and autumn of 1940 (after the German conquest of France) the German air force tried to gain air superiority over the English Channel and southern England so that Germany could invade Britain. The British Royal Air Force (RAF) fought with great determination against the Germans and made the fight so costly that the Germans had to give up the idea of invading Britain. What was this mostly air battle called?

options.text: the Battle of the Air Forces

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Battle of Britain

questions.question: The final major battle of World War Two was on this Pacific island where the US took heavy casualties both in the ground forces and the navy before capturing the island. The fanatical defense of the island by the Japanese, including kamikaze attacks, was probably a factor influencing the US to drop the atomic bombs in hopes of ending the war without another blood bath. What was the name of the island?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Okinawa

questions.question: In late 1944, Hitler scraped up a strong force including armor and caught the American forces by surprise near the Belgium - German border. In the biggest battle fought in northwest Europe in 1944-45, the Germans pushed back the US defense line considerably until reinforcements and British help halted the German advance and eventually pushed them back into Germany. What name is this battle known by?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the Battle of the Bulge

quizzes.title: Literature Quiz: Archie Goodwin and Nero Wolfe
quizzes.description: Test your literature knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Literature, basilisk, gryffindor. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Generations of Catholics have worshipped this young saint, nicknamed the Little Flower.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Therese of Lisieux

questions.question: Who cursed the bludger that broke Harry Potters arm?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Doby the House Elf

questions.question: In Poison a la Carte, Archie Goodwin compares the color of a womans hair to cornsilk before it begins to turn. What color is cornsilk before it begins to turn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yellowish green

questions.question: In Where Theres a Will, Nero Wolfe solves the case with the aid of a centaurea cyanis. What kind of flower is a centaurea cyanis?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: cornflower

questions.question: Is Severus Snape a member of Gryffindor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: What is the occupation of Hermiones parents?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dentists

questions.question: Nero Wolfe isnt the only character in Rex Stouts books who knows a thing or two. In Some Buried Caesar, when Archie first meets his soon-to-be girlfriend Lily Rowan, she gives him the nickname Escamillo. Where did she get that name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: From an opera

questions.question: It is believed that on April 1, 1375 she received the stigmata of Christ.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Saint Catherine of Siena

questions.question: What part of Fawkes healed Harry Potters wound after the fight with the basilisk?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tears

questions.question: How did Mrs. Norris end up petrified by the basilisk in Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets?

options.text: She saw the basilisk in a mirror.
She saw a reflection of the basilisk.
She saw a photo of the basilisk.
She looked at the basilisk straight in the eye.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She saw a reflection of the basilisk.

questions.question: In The League of Frightened Men, Archie Goodwin uses the term viva voce incorrectly. What does viva voce mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: by word of mouth

questions.question: St. Joan of Arc is one of the patron saints of Belgium.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In Death of a Doxy, Nero Wolfe recognizes that the name Milton Thales is a play on Thales of Miletus. Who was Thales of Miletus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Greek philosopher

questions.question: In The Black Mountain, Nero Wolfe and his assistant Archie Goodwin are traveling in Europe and are almost arrested and taken to Titograd. By what name do we know Titograd?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Podgorica, Montenegro

questions.question: In The Silent Speaker, Archie Goodwin mentions that the Mound Builders left more traces in his home state of Ohio than anywhere else. Which of these do we know for certain about the Mound Builders?

options.text: They were all destroyed by glacial activity.
They were all killed by neighboring tribes.
They discovered both writing and mathematics.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: None of these
